name: Anis
company_description: Universal wall-mounted charging stations for robots
objectives: build thought leadership in robotics infrastructure
attract technical co-founders and early hires
build a community around robotics charging

tone.perspective: founder who sees infrastructure problems others ignore

personal_brand: the guy who looks at the charger, not the robot. sees the unsexy infrastructure gap behind every hype cycle.
example_posts:
saw a 200lb robot crawl to a floor-mounted proprietary charging dock yesterday.

felt like 2008 phone chargers all over again.

every robotics company builds their own charger.

none of them want to be a charging company.

that's the opportunity.

robotics is scaling. charging infrastructure isn't.

saw it firsthand yesterday. wide open.

twitter.format: 2-liner or 3-liner max. hook + punchline. no hashtags.

linkedin.format: short paragraphs, personal story, lesson. no corporate fluff.
